result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam K. Wilund was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed. 

No bars, taverns, liquor stores, beer tents.  

No contact with The Store and Kwik Trip.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office. 

Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  

AODA and follow up.    

DNA sample

COURT has no objection to early release from probation if restitution has been paid in full

73 days credit if revoked.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam K. Wilund

records.addlTxt: (Amended Order being filed to reflect correct amount)

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  10:32 a.m. 
INCLUDES 21CM72, 21CM73, 21CM822, 22CM408.
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher for ADA Zibolski. 
Defendant appears in person from MCJ with Atty Anne Katte.  

Date and time set for JPTC; VRCW. 
Parties are ready to proceed with plea today. 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

21CM73>>State moves to DRI Count 1 (Possession of THC); COURT grants. 

21CM822>>State moves to DRI Count 1 (Retail Theft-Intentionally Take <-$500); COURT grants.  

22CM408>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 2 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor); COURT grants. 
Count 3 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor); COURT grants.
Count 4 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor); COURT grants.

PLEA: 

21CM72>>Count 1 (Retail Theft-Intentionally Take <=$500): GUILTY.  

22CM408>>Count 1 (Retail Theft-Intentionally Take <=$500):  GUILTY.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS on each count: SWH for 9 months probation.

CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  AODA and follow up.  Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed. No bars, taverns, liquor stores, beer tents.  No contact with The Store and Kwik Trip.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge.  Restitution (21CM72) in the amount of $14.21 including 10% surcharge to Kwik Trip.  Restitution (21CM822) in the amount of $1.39 including 10% surcharge to The Store; apply to 21CM72.  Restitution (22CM408) in the amount of $9.54 including 10% surcharge to Kwik Trip.  

COURT has no objection to early release from probation if restitution has been paid in full

COURT grants 76 days credit in 21CM72 and 73 days credit in 22CM408, if revoked. 

Adj:  10:49 a.m.
